title: Describe charge of three objects from observations

content.prompt: Three objects—X, Y, and Z—are each given an excess electric charge. The objects are then brought near each other in pairs but do not touch. It is found that X and Y attract each other, Y and Z repel, and X and Z attract. Which of the following is a correct conclusion about the signs of the charges that can be drawn from these observations?

choices.label: X and Y have charges of the same sign, and Z has a charge of the opposite sign.
X and Z have charges of the same sign, and Y has a charge of the opposite sign.
Y and Z have charges of the same sign, and X has a charge of the opposite sign.
X, Y, and Z all have charges of the same sign.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
